Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk 389-ds-base
exit 0

exit 0

#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: 389-ds-base bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The 389 Directory Server is an LDAPv3 compliant server. The base packages include the LDAP server and command-line utilities for server administration. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, when updating multiple back ends at the same time, the memberOf and retrocl plug-ins entered a deadlock state. This update adds scoping to retrocl that allows subtrees and suffixes to be included or excluded. Also, the existing memberOf scoping has been moved outside of its global lock, and thus now avoids the deadlock. (BZ#1258318) This update fixes a macro definition problem that occurred when activating enhanced ACL for the MODRDN operation. (BZ#1259466) Previously, complex filters in a search request did not work as expected. With this update, the filter optimization no longer mistakenly ignores certain complex subfilters. (BZ#1259999) Prior to this update, the "No original_tombstone for changenumber" error message was logged unnecessarily when original_tombstone did not exist. As a consequence, the error log contained redundant entries. Now, the error message is logged only when needed. (BZ#1260000) Previously, after the cleanAllRUV task finished, the change log still contained entries from the cleaned rid. As a consequence, the RUV could contain undesirable data, and the RUV element could be missing the replica URL. Now, cleanAllRUV cleans change log completely as expected. (BZ#1260001) Previously, there was a problem with a dangling pointer in the entry object pointing CSNSet used in the replication, which could lead to memory problems. The underlying source code has been modified to fix this bug, and memory problems no longer occur. (BZ#1262363) Users of 389-ds-base are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. After installing this update, the 389 server service will be restarted automatically. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
